          value = if_salv_c_layout=>restrict_none.

      o_cols = o_alv->get_columns( ).
      TRY.
          o_column = o_cols->get_column( 'FILES' ).
          o_column->set_long_text( 'Downloaded Files' ).
          o_column->set_medium_text( 'Downloaded Files' ).
          o_column->set_short_text( 'Files' ).
          o_column->set_output_length( 50 ).
        CATCH cx_salv_not_found.                        "#EC NO_HANDLER
      ENDTRY.


      o_alv->get_functions( )->set_all( ).

*   set the Column optimization
      o_cols->set_optimize( 'X' ).

      o_alv->display( ).

    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form download
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      --> LS_BKPF
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM download  USING    p_ls_bkpf TYPE gty_bkpf.
  DATA: ls_object        TYPE sibflporb,
        lt_objects       TYPE sibflporbt,
        doc_id           TYPE sofolenti1-doc_id,
        lt_doc_id        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF srgbtbrel,
        lt_links_a       TYPE obl_t_link,
        lt_links_b       TYPE obl_t_link,
        lt_objectheader  TYPE srm_t_solisti1,
        lt_objectcontent TYPE srm_t_solisti1,
        lt_content_hex   TYPE tabtype_solix,
        ls_doc_data      TYPE sofolenti1,
        lt_links_table   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF srgbtbrel,
        lt_att           TYPE solix_tab,
        lv_lin           TYPE i,
        lv_length        TYPE i,
        lv_doc_id        TYPE sofolenti1-doc_id,
        lv_xstring       TYPE xstring,
        lv_filename      TYPE string,
        lvfile           TYPE string,
        lv_ext           TYPE char4,
        lv_index         TYPE char4.

  CONSTANTS : lv_fil TYPE char15 VALUE '*XFLOW INVOICE*'.

  ls_object-instid = p_ls_bkpf-bukrs && p_ls_bkpf-belnr && p_ls_bkpf-gjahr.
  SELECT * FROM srgbtbrel INTO TABLE lt_links_table
       WHERE instid_a = ls_object-instid.
  IF sy-subrc EQ 0 .


    LOOP AT lt_links_table INTO DATA(ls_links).
      MOVE ls_links-instid_b TO doc_id.
      CLEAR :ls_doc_data,lt_content_hex,lt_objectcontent,lt_objectheader,lv_length.
      CALL FUNCTION 'SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1'
        EXPORTING
          document_id                = doc_id
*         FILTER                     = 'X '
        IMPORTING
          document_data              = ls_doc_data
        TABLES
          object_header              = lt_objectheader
          object_content             = lt_objectcontent
          contents_hex               = lt_content_hex
        EXCEPTIONS
          document_id_not_exist      = 1
          operation_no_authorization = 2
          x_error                    = 3
          OTHERS                     = 4.

*       Convert content of file from SOLIX to XSTRING
*      es_doc_info = ls_doc_data.
      TRANSLATE ls_doc_data-obj_descr TO UPPER CASE.
      IF ls_doc_data-obj_descr CP lv_fil.
        APPEND ls_links TO lt_doc_id.
        CLEAR doc_id.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    DESCRIBE TABLE lt_doc_id LINES DATA(lv_lines).
    IF lv_lines GT 1.
      DATA(lv_MULT) = abap_true.
    ENDIF.

*    DELETE lt_links_table WHERE instid_b NOT IN lt_doc_id.

    LOOP AT lt_doc_id INTO DATA(lw_links).
      WRITE sy-tabix TO lv_index.
      MOVE lw_links-instid_b TO doc_id.
      CLEAR :ls_doc_data,lt_content_hex,lt_objectcontent,lt_objectheader,lv_length.
      CALL FUNCTION 'SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1'
        EXPORTING
          document_id                = doc_id
*         FILTER                     = 'X '
        IMPORTING
          document_data              = ls_doc_data
        TABLES
          object_header              = lt_objectheader
          object_content             = lt_objectcontent
          contents_hex               = lt_content_hex
        EXCEPTIONS
          document_id_not_exist      = 1
          operation_no_authorization = 2
          x_error                    = 3
          OTHERS                     = 4.

*       Convert content of file from SOLIX to XSTRING
*      es_doc_info = ls_doc_data.
      TRANSLATE ls_doc_data-obj_descr TO UPPER CASE.
      IF ls_doc_data-obj_descr CP lv_fil.
        lv_length = ls_doc_data-doc_size.
        IF lt_content_hex IS NOT INITIAL.
          CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_BINARY_TO_XSTRING'
            EXPORTING
              input_length = lv_length
            IMPORTING
              buffer       = lv_xstring
            TABLES
              binary_tab   = lt_content_hex
            EXCEPTIONS ##FM_SUBRC_OK
              failed       = 1
              OTHERS       = 2.
        ENDIF.

* 2. Download to File
        lv_filename = p_file ."'. " Or any desired filename
        IF ls_doc_data-obj_type EQ 'XLS'.
          lv_ext = 'XLSX'.
        ELSEIF  ls_doc_data-obj_type = 'DOC'.
          lv_ext = 'DOCX'.
        ELSE.
          lv_ext = ls_doc_data-obj_type.
        ENDIF.

        CONCATENATE ls_object-instid '_' ls_doc_data-obj_descr INTO lv_filename.

        IF lv_mult EQ abap_true.
          CONDENSE lv_index.
          CONCATENATE p_ls_bkpf-belnr '_' lv_index INTO lv_filename.
        ELSE.
          lv_filename = p_ls_bkpf-belnr  .
        ENDIF.
        CONCATENATE p_file '\' lv_filename '.' lv_ext INTO lvfile.
        ls_output-files = lv_filename && '.' && lv_ext.
        ls_output-belnr = p_ls_bkpf-belnr.
        ls_output-gjahr = p_ls_bkpf-gjahr.
        ls_output-bukrs = p_ls_bkpf-bukrs.
        CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
          EXPORTING
            filename = lvfile
            filetype = 'BIN'
          TABLES
            data_tab = lt_content_hex.
        IF sy-subrc EQ 0 .
          APPEND ls_output TO lt_output.
          CLEAR ls_output.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

 

Testing :

Open the transaction code 

 

 

Populated details of:

 

Search with Doc NoManually paste/type the document number desires
Company CodeXXXX
Fiscal Year2025
Directory path for file downloadTemp

 

 

Execute

Please wait for the downloading to be done

 

 

Benefits of a Custom Program:

  • Automation: Automates the entire process, saving countless hours of manual work.

  • Flexibility: Can be customized to filter by any criteria and save files in a specific naming convention.

  • Scalability: Can handle hundreds or even thousands of invoices at a time.

Conclusion

While SAP provides standard functionalities for viewing individual attachments, a mass download capability is not part of the standard offering. For true mass downloads, a custom ABAP program is the most efficient and recommended solution. It's a one-time development effort that can save significant time and effort in the long run, particularly for Accounts Payable teams, auditors, and IT administrators.

If you are facing this challenge, consider reaching out to your in-house ABAP team or an SAP consulting partner to develop a custom solution that fits your business needs perfectly.

entry.title: Balance Validation accelerating the period closing by Superb validation, automation and analytics
entry.content:
Join us for co-innovation

We would like to invite the public cloud customers joining us for the co-innovation of AI capability AI assisted Balance Validation Rule Creation, and if you are with valid FBA, please feel free to reply me in this blog, and we are looking forward meeting you.

Let's shape the future together. 

Challenge

Organizations often face challenges such as a financial close process that struggles to reach peak performance, characterized by inefficiencies and delayed timelines. Additionally, governance and compliance requirements can become overly burdensome, consuming valuable time with extensive data collection and documentation efforts. Furthermore, there is frequently a lack of transparency and insight across system boundaries, which hampers decision-making and collaboration. Tackling these issues requires a strategic approach that involves process optimization, technology adoption, and fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.

Key capabilities in financial management systems are designed to enhance accuracy, efficiency, and communication.

  • Managing validation rules and groups standardizes these processes, preventing financial misstatements and reducing audit and compliance risks.
  • Automated balance validation tasks accelerate the closing process and minimize manual efforts, freeing up valuable time for strategic activities.
  • Real-time validation analytics provide immediate insights and maintain a comprehensive audit trail, ensuring transparency and accountability.
  • The ability to add comments facilitates smooth communication between subsidiaries and headquarters, ensuring alignment and reducing misunderstandings. Together, these capabilities transform financial operations, driving reliability and efficiency.

Balance Validation plays a critical role in supporting Accounting and Group Reporting, especially when integrated with Advanced Financial Closing processes. This function ensures that all accounts are accurately reconciled and validated, providing a strong foundation for precise financial reporting. By incorporating Balance Validation into the closing cycle, organizations can identify discrepancies early, reduce errors, and enhance the integrity of their financial statements. This integration not only accelerates the closing process but also strengthens group reporting by ensuring consistent and reliable data across all levels of the organization, thereby supporting compliance and informed strategic decision-making.

The application of Manage Balance Validation Rules and Groups provides a centralized platform for defining and managing validation rules that prevent financial misstatements and mitigate compliance risks. 

The application Scheduled Balance Validation Jobs accelerates the financial closing cycle while significantly reducing manual workload by automating balance validation tasks. 

The application View Balance Validation Results offers immediate insights and maintains an audit trail, ensuring transparency. Furthermore, it facilitates seamless communication between subsidiaries and headquarters, ensuring alignment and effective coordination across all financial activities.

Roadmap

We will provide AI assisted Balance Validation Rule Creation on S/4HANA Public Cloud to empower business users by simplifying the rule definition process, enhancing flexibility, and improving responsiveness to customer-specific requirements, reducing the dependency on business process experts.

Users initiate requests using straightforward business language. The AI then analyzes historical data and industry best practices to draft a proposed validation rule, incorporating common elements such as G/L account hierarchy nodes and function areas. This intelligent proposal streamlines the rule creation process, minimizing the need for specialized expertise. Users can subsequently review the draft, make necessary adjustments, and save or activate the rule, ensuring it aligns with organizational requirements and enhances the accuracy and efficiency of financial operations.


 

 

Here is the help document about Balance Validation capability,

Balance Validation | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: GL Planning in S4 Hana Fiori Launchpad:
entry.content:
GL Planning in S4 Hana Fiori Launchpad: 

In SAP S/4HANA, GL planning is performed through the Fiori Launchpad, offering a user-friendly and intuitive interface for financial planning activities.

Steps:

Configuration that is required for GL planning in SAP S/4HANA. Plan Category needed to be created in the system through SPRO Customizing. The configuration path is shown in the attached screenshot.

Create the Plan Category exactly as shown in the configuration screenshot below.

Next, access the Fiori Launchpad by entering transaction code “/n/ui2/flp” and proceed to log in.

Then, navigate to the 'Import Financial Plan Data' tile within the Fiori Launchpad.

After selecting the tile, click on 'Download Templates' as shown in the screenshot, and download the template for 'P&L Statement Planning'.

Below is the attached GL planning template that needs to be filled out. If required, you can also add additional fields such as Profit Center and Cost Center by identifying the relevant field names from the following SAP help page: SAP Help – Financial Plan Data Fields."

Once the template is filled with the required planning data, upload it using the same 'Import Financial Plan Data' tile in the Fiori Launchpad.

After uploading the file, navigate to the 'Display Financial Plan Data' tile to review the uploaded planning information.

 

 

After selecting the tile, enter the planning parameters as shown in the attached screenshot. Additionally, activate the navigation panel from the top left corner to include more parameter-based views, such as Profit Center, if it was included in your planning data.

 

 

To analyze Plan vs Actual data, you need to activate the 'P&L - Actual/Plan' tile in Fiori. This tile allows you to compare planned and actual figures at the Financial Statement Version (FSV) level, including its individual nodes, as shown in the screenshot below.

Summary: 
GL Planning in SAP S/4HANA, enabled through the Fiori Launchpad, provides a simple yet powerful approach for financial planners. From defining a plan category to importing data and analyzing plan vs. actual figures, the process is streamlined and user-friendly. With these capabilities, organizations can achieve better control and visibility over financial planning processes.

entry.title: Embedded Finance in SAP: SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity with J.P. Morgan Payments
entry.content:
Enterprises are rethinking how to connect banking capabilities with ERP processes to maximize business value. Key questions include:

  • How to make payments, reconciliation, and cash visibility seamless and fully integrated between banks and the ERP system?
  • How to adopt innovations like real-time payments or real-time cash balances without launching a new IT project every time a banking service gets added?
  • How to unlock the combined value of invoice and payment data in the ERP alongside the cash and financial data held by banks?

SAP and J.P. Morgan asked themselves the same questions. And as a result decided to collaborate and partner even closer to bring more value to shared clients by better integrating the capabilities of both by accelerating adoption of SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC) to deliver J.P. Morgan bank services embedded in ERP processes.

With SAP MBC, corporates get direct, standardized access to J.P. Morgan banking services directly integrated into their payment and cash processes. As a result corporates can scale new services faster, without custom builds and with minimal ongoing maintenance and benefit from the seamless and many times real time data flow to get the decision advantage crucial in todays fast and ever changing business world.

What you can expect

  • Seamless connectivity: Integrate J.P. Morgan services via SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity to connect your SAP ERP to J.P. Morgan Payments using standardized, bank-approved channels.
  • Automate payments and reporting: The J.P. Morgan Payments Adapter 2.0 supports file-based payments (ACH, checks, virtual cards, wires—including FX) and real-time payments across the U.S., EU, UK, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, and Hong Kong.
  • Real-time insights: Access instant reporting and reconciliation, view account balances and transaction details, and track payments through advanced APIs.
  • Easy implementation: Prebuilt adapters and help you go live quickly and securely
  • AI-powered treasury: Leverage SAP’s cloud data foundation and AI-driven capabilities to interact with J.P. Morgan and elevate treasury operations.

Who can benefit

  • New and existing J.P. Morgan clients using SAP S/4HANA (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, or On-Premise) or SAP ECC (6.0+)
  • Organizations operating on J.P. Morgan Access, with support for multi-bank reporting across non–J.P. Morgan DDAs
  • Teams seeking flexible connection options through SAP MBC to tailor integrations to specific business needs

This collaboration meets clients where they are simplifying connectivity while strengthening control and visibility at the same time, and accelerating access to new banking innovations, all embedded in SAP ERP processes.

Want to know more?

  • SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity 
    • https://www.sap.com/germany/products/financial-management/multi-bank-connectivity.html 
    • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_MULTI_BANK_CONNECTIVITY
  • J.P. Morgan SAP Integration:
    • https://partners.jpmorgan.com/sap_s4hana.html
  • SAP and J.P. Morgan Partnership:
    • https://digital.jpmorgan.com/jpmorgan-with-sap/index.html

Still want to know more?

Meet us at the AFP Conference in Boston on October 26–29 or attend SAP and J.P. Morgan session at the AFP and J.P. Morgan Booth on Tuesday Oct 28th  2-2.30pm local Boston time

entry.title: Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion (UCFC)/CustOnTmp
entry.content:
What is CustOnTmp : The downtime-optimized conversion (doC) executes the FIN data conversion on the temporary instance during the uptime. For this, SUM needs the FIN Customizing to apply it prior to the data conversion. Until now, this required a standard conversion run prior to each doC run. In this standard run, the FIN Customizing was created and added to a transport request. Such a transport request is required to be provided to each doC run.

With the new feature Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion, FIN delta Customizing activities can be performed directly on the temporary instance of the doC run. With this, the number of required standard conversion runs is reduced to one standard conversion at the beginning of the project. All FIN delta Customizing activities can be directly done on the temporary instance of the doC run. For each new doC iteration, the initial FIN Customizing transport request is used (created in standard conversion) together with all the delta Customizing transport requests prepared with each new iteration.  It is no longer required to always run a standard conversion before each doC cycle

Prerequisites 

  • Target release SAP S/4HANA 2022 (or higher)
  • DOC with database migration (so no in place conversion; migration is possible also for source on SAP HANA)
  • SUM 2.0 SP 23 (or higher)

Differences Between Standard doC and Uptime Customizing

The uptime customizing will by default add most application tables to the uptime handling automatically. This means, the manual selection of tables for uptime migration becomes mostly obsolete. The SUM will no longer display the respective section on downtime-optimized DMO (with file specification "table list"). If there are still tables which cause a significant runtime during phase EU_CLONE_MIG_DT_RUN they can still be added manually using CRRTABLIST.LST as in regular doC approach.

Every application table in uptime handling gets either a replication trigger or a freeze trigger in the source system.

The reasons for a freeze trigger are:

  • Customizing table with delivery class C, E or G
  • Static classification in SUM which requires a read-only restriction

Freeze Trigger 

Freeze triggers are needed to ensure the consistency of the uptime conversion. Freeze triggers are used in 3 different ways as below

  • Hard Freeze 

Freeze triggers are used to prevent customizing changes in the source system which might influence and invalidate the uptime conversion which is done in parallel to production on the temporary instance. This means that the number of freeze tables is significantly higher as in regular doC approach, although it should not add additional business restrictions as most of the freeze triggers are defined on pure customizing table which are not changed directly in a productive system. Nevertheless, the Impact analysis is of a higher importance for the doC with Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion approach. The hard freeze will be activated during the preparation in phase SQLDB_FREEZE_TRIG_MODE_SWITCH_SMIG_TCR and will remain until the end of the doC procedure.

Please refer the   to SAP Note 2481983 - SUM Impact Analysis for downtime-optimized DMO

  • Temporary Freeze 

Some tables only be set read-only for a short period of time, for example while the Asset Accounting is prepared for the Uptime Conversion.

  • Freeze on Temporary System 

There will be freeze triggers used on the temporary instance between the SUM phases RUN_SMIG_SFIN_CUST_ON_TEMP_FREEZE and RUN_SMIG_SFIN_CUST_ON_TEMP_FREEZE_REV.

As tables must only be changed either by production operation (business users on system) on source system or by the customizing activities on the temporary system, all tables which can be changed by production operation will be set to read-only on the temporary system to avoid conflicting changes. It is, therefore, possible that a Customizing activity on the temporary instance fails with a short dump. In this case, create an incident  on component BC-UPG-DTM-TLA to clarify the access.

Some tables can be changed on source system and temporary system. Additionally, it is ensured that this does not cause a conflict or there is a special handling implementation like for number ranges. For more information, refer to section 3.1 Number Ranges in this SAP Note.

Execution 

During each doC execution, you must check in phase REQ_DOCMAX_DELTA_CUSTOMIZING that the provided FIN customizing that was added via CTI buffer is still valid.

doC with Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion allows to add additional Customizing directly shortly before the uptime phase PARRUN_SMIG_SFIN. To do so, perform the following steps:

  1. SUM will stop in dialog phase REQ_DOCMAX_DELTA_CUSTOMIZING.
  2. Perform the IMG activities listed under "IMG/Conversion of Accounting to SAP S/4HANA / Preparations and Migration of Customizing" in each relevant client. Use transaction SPRO in the respective clients to perform the needed customizing steps.
    Note: to identify if there are any delta customizing activities required, the customizing activities must be executed step by step (this information can't be provided by the tool).

        Remark: The Customizing activities must be strictly restricted to the required Finance conversion Customizing.                                         3.  Start the uptime FIN conversion by continuing SUM

 Restricted tables for Uptime Handling

The following tables must not be added manually to uptime using CRRTABLIST.LST to avoid potential issues during Delta Customizing for the S/4HANA Finance Conversion.

BALHDR, BALDAT and BAL_INDX

Customizing on the Temporary Instance

  • Preparation of Number Range “RF_BELEG” for New Document Type for Postings in Controlling

When using the Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion approach, the preparation of data migration requires a new document type for postings in Controlling that considers also a new number range object “RF_BELEG”.

Available options for Number Range Number definition for controlling document type:

  • In target system(S/4HANA):After SFIN Data Migration completion, before releasing the system to business users (the recommended one)
  • During S/4HANA Standard Customizing preparation with the inclusion into the FI customizing transport request of the CO number ranges numbers;

In source system (ECC): Before the start of S/4HANA technical activities

  • Preparations and Migration of Customizing for Controlling

Maintain Operating Concern (KEA0)” on the temporary instance is not possible due to read-only restriction on table TKES2 and CEFORMT. Execute “Maintain Operating Concern” only after SFIN delta migration is completed, as an after-migration activity, outside of SUM tool.

Restrictions

Depreciation calculation: Due to a read-only restriction on table T093D it is not allowed to run depreciation calculation when triggers are active in the system. This restriction only applies if table T093D is a logical pool table. If a mitigation is needed for this restriction you can get in contact with SUM development team raising an incident on BC-UPG-DTM-TLA.

 

Reference Notes:

3428570 - Executing and Monitoring Downtime-Optimized Conversion to SAP S/4HANA with Customizing on Temporary System


3388323 Executing and Monitoring Downtime-Optimized Conversion to SAP S/4HANA with SUM 2.0 SP 19

Other Important Links :

SAP Support Portal: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset 

SAP Help Portal: Preprocessing | SAP Help Portal.

SAP Help Portal: Customizing Freeze | SAP Help Portal.
